title: Question With No Meaningful Answer
question_text:
Robin asked $80$ children to identify their favorite season. The results are shown below.
Robin also asked $60$ adults to identify their favorite season. The results are shown below.
Which of the following questions cannot be answered in a meaningful way from Robin's sets of data?

choices.text: What is the average (mean) number of individuals who responded "Spring"?
What is the combined proportion of individuals who responded "Summer"?
What is the combined frequency of "Fall" as a response?
Among those surveyed, was "Winter" more popular among children or adults?
Among those surveyed, was favorite season the same for both children and adults?

solution:
We know that 80 children were surveyed and that 25% said "Spring". This means that the actual number of children who said "Spring" was (80)(0.25) or 20 children.

We also know that 60 adults were surveyed and that 40% said "Spring". This means that the actual number of adults who said "Spring" was (60)(0.40) or 24 adults.

Trying to calculate an average (or mean) however, is more troublesome.

The formula for calculating the average for a data set is:

average =
sum of all values in the data set
number of values in the data set

Robin has collected data from two different sets of individuals - children and adults. Furthermore, the information she has collected from the individuals in each data set do not consist of numerical values that can be added in order to find a sum. Rather, the responses fall into one of four different categories - Spring, Summer, Fall and Winter. Therefore, the type of data that Robin has collected, does not lend itself to being able to calculate an average.

Perhaps we could calculate an average here by adding the number of "Spring" responses from each data set and then dividing by 2
for the fact that there are two data sets. We would get:

average =
20+24
2
=22

The problem then becomes trying to attach meaning to this value. What does 22
as an average really represent? Since there is no meaningful way to interpret this value, Choice 'A' is the correct answer.
